qas.question: When did Napoleon begin religious schooling in Autun?
Where was the first military academy Napoleon attended located?
Why did other students often tease Napoleon?
According to a school examiner, Napoleon was best at which academic subject?

context: Napoleon's noble, moderately affluent background afforded him greater opportunities to study than were available to a typical Corsican of the time. In <a0_0>January 1779<a0_0/>, he was enrolled at a religious school in Autun. In May, he was admitted to a military academy at <a1_0>Brienne-le-Château<a1_0/>. His first language was <a2_0>Corsican<a2_0/>, and he always spoke French with a marked Corsican accent and never learned to spell French properly. He was teased by other students for <a3_0>his accent<a3_0/> and applied himself to reading. An examiner observed that Napoleon "has always been distinguished for his application in <a4_0>mathematics<a4_0/>. He is fairly well acquainted with history and geography... This boy would make an excellent sailor."[note 3]
